description: Numbers n such that 2^n + 5 is prime.
comments: The subsequence of primes starts 3, 5, 11, 47, 53, 191, ... - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 07 2010For k in this sequence, 2^(k-1)*(2^k+5) is in A141548: numbers of deficiency 6. - _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 23 2015a(18) > 5*10^5. - _Robert Price_, Aug 23 2015
author: Tony Davie (ad(AT)dcs.st-and.ac.uk), Jan 21 2001
extensions: More terms from Santi Spadaro, Oct 04, 2002
a(13)-a(15) from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Oct 07 2011
